paper_abstract: Let Gamma be a (not necessarily finite) structure with a finite relational signature. We prove that deciding whether a given existential positive sentence holds in Gamma is in LogSpace or complete for the class CSP(Gamma)(NP) under deterministic polynomial-time many-one reductions. Here, CSP(Gamma)(NP) is the class of problems that can be reduced to the constraint satisfaction problem of Gamma under non-deterministic polynomial-time many-one reductions.
paper_title: Complexity of existential positive first-order logic
